On Wed, Oct 01, 2003 at 11:34:01AM -0400, jalgermissen@... wrote:
> Ah, interesting. This focusses on the collaborative aspect of the Web
> and kind of makes it possible for the Semantic Web to grow while
> still being "on the Web". Did I get that right?

I think so.  I like the way you phrased that, as if this were a feature
rather than a bug.  Nice.

> OTH: is that documented somewhere?

Not AFAICT.

> Why is there an ongoing
> debate within RDF/SW about what certain URIs denote and what not?
> (e.g. fragment-identifier-URIs pointing to Web pages etc.)

I don't think there's any one answer to that, unfortunately.
Everybody sees things slightly differently.

> IOW: Is it *your* explanation/position? REST's position?  Is the
> RDF/SW community aware of this view at all?

It's mine, and I believe it to be in synch with Roy's, but I don't
think REST-the-architectural-style talks about it.  I figure it's an
emergent property of REST, or any style in which identifiers can be
late bound to representations (i.e. pretty much every large scale
system around).

Yes, the SW community is aware of this view.  The whole "public meaning"
discussion is about it, and many involved seem to also see things this
way, at least in part.

Mark.
